section.title: Formatting expectations
section.p: Processors typically use the following conventions:

ul.li: The term (dt) is usually against the starting margin of the page or column.
The description or definition (dd) is either indented and on the next line or on the same line after the term.
The dlhead generally looks like a table heading row.

section.title: Attributes
section.p: The following attributes are available on this element: , , and .

example.title: Examples
example.p: In the following code sample, a definition list is used to describe message levels generated by a piece of monitoring software. The compact attribute instructs processors to tighten the vertical spacing.
example.codeblock: <dl compact="yes"> <dlentry> <dt>Warning</dt> <dd>Problems were detected, but the software will continue monintoring activity.</dd> </dlentry> <dlentry> <dt>Error</dt> <dd>Problems were detected, and the software is in danger of shutting down.</dd> </dlentry> <dlentry> <dt>Severe</dt> <dd>Monitoring activity has ceased.</dd> </dlentry> </dl>
